context.problem: Select appropriate technology stack for building a shadcn/ui-compatible component registry with optimal performance and developer experience
constraints: Must be compatible with shadcn CLI

decision.summary: Use Next.js 16, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS v4, Biome, Vitest, and Bun as the core technology stack
decision.details: Next.js 16 provides App Router with Server Components for optimal performance and SEO. TypeScript ensures type safety across the codebase. Tailwind CSS v4 offers modern utility-first styling. Biome replaces ESLint+Prettier for faster linting and formatting. Vitest provides fast unit testing. Bun offers faster package management and script execution. Radix UI primitives power the shadcn/ui components.

alternatives.reason: Less ecosystem support and shadcn compatibility compared to Next.js
Biome offers better performance and unified tooling
Bun provides significantly faster installation and execution times

decision.rationale: This stack provides the best balance of performance, developer experience, and ecosystem support. Next.js 16 is the de facto standard for React applications with SSR. Biome and Bun offer modern, faster alternatives to traditional tools.
consequences: Strong type safety with TypeScript strict mode
Some dependencies on newer tools (Biome, Bun) may have limited community resources

examples.description: Core dependencies including Next.js 16, React 19, Radix UI, Motion, and Zod
Biome configuration for linting and formatting
